content: This clash is good but a bit TOO lengthy, and DEFINITELY not solvable in 5 minutes unless you're a superhuman. I got this as a clash and it was STRESSFUL, it took 14 minutes to solve with a 100% and no-one in the clash was determined to solve it.

This is impossible to solve in 5 minutes, and very hard to solve in 15 in its current form.

The numbers in the statement should have underscores so that clashers can copy+paste from there to help build the hash table for converting the input into digits.

Or perhaps better would be to replace the {{123}} example with {{1234567890}} as:
_XXXX___XXXX____XXXXX___XXXXX___XX__XX__XXXXXX___XXXXX__XXXXXX___XXXX____XXXX__XXXX_
XX__XX____XX_____XXXX___XXXXX____XXXXX___XXXX___XXXXX_______XX___XXXX____XXXXX_XXXX_

It's too much setup work to even start coding currently. I ended up winning my clash with just 20% because everyone else got 0% including 3 bots. :/

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: very nice

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Approved the contribution. Comment: A great easy puzzle, it would be great to see what can be done more quickly.

Suggestion:
Given the length of time the setup for a clash, I recommend making the first example's intended output 0123456789.
This way, the user has a pre-setup first and third line for every number with _'s.

It's a neat puzzle but seems pretty long for a clash.

I solved it in under 15 minutes but definitely not the "solvable in less than 5 minutes" guideline. Even simply creating the digit lookup array in your provided solution takes 20 select+copy+pastes. Alternatively, those two lines can be parsed and converted into the digit array in code which is fast to type but still more work than some entire clashes.

The idea itself is good though and it would work well as an easy puzzle.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting puzzle, with an original input.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: An easy great puzzle,
would be great to see what can be done in shortest.
This problem look really interesting to solve

Goal
* Please change ''' to ``` for the correct formatting syntax (4 times).

* Please format "_" as a {{constant}} instead of a [[variable]].

Input
* Please change "[[2*rows]]" to "2 * [[rows]]".

* Please format "_" as a {{constant}} instead of a [[variable]].

Cases
* Please swap Validator 4 and Test 5 so that each individual pair of cases are more similar.

Thanks.
Ok done. But added '[' and ']' to see empty lines in second code
Thank you for the feedbak. I notice for easy puzzle.
Once again, I had a clash with this where the winner had 20%. This time I tried to solve it, but ended up losing track of my code and couldn't even submit 20% because my final code was unfinished.

Better to just use a Unicode white space character "　" instead of "[" and "]" to avoid confusion.

Also, I've just noticed that the output of Validator 5 is greater than 2³² but that of Test 5 is smaller than 2³². It may cause an issue for the players of some programming languages - they may use the correct integer type for the tests but still fail the validator. Is it possible to revise Validator 5?

Thanks again.
